9ITy-fCkGHLu3bwgTAQHUg.text: Don't let the exterior of this place fool you, food was very good. Prices were excellent and food took less than 10 minutes to come out. Would come back again.

_wu93TVnNd5AU3tCdEBJ4g.text: Looks like your typical fast food place on the outside but the food is a step up from all the other berto type fast food joints.  Lots of choices and free chips and salsa.

v7ZAnHDcWGjRG34wwutjEg.text: I think this is one of the most authentic Mexican taco shops around......I've never had anything I don't like. Plus, they keep things very clean inside.   The burritos are HUGE, even the tacos are pretty big. The tortillas are *perfect* and the refried beans are sooooooooooo good!! (the fish tacos too!)  I love that they have free chips and a salsa bar with cucumbers and radishes (a typical taco shop thing) They offer different specials, just be sure to read the hand written pappers taped above the cash register.   This place isn't anything fancy, but the food really is good....and it's cheap! (fair warning: don't come here on a diet, haha)

ORkFyvv_3pNKsUtelayy6A.text: Definitely a solid choice for a quick mexi meal. Great variety of salsa, all were delicious. Our breakfast burritos delicioso!

-v4WRat-ZF2PoLqeMq0Z7A.text: This place is a dive but very good...good meal under 6-7 bucks... slow service but worth the wait...great place to stop when your camping out at a local hotel.

8Vb5IXdM69-a8ejog-SSeg.text: Best Mexican food restaurant in State! Ever since my first time trying food here, I never and never will go to any other Mexican food restaurant. Food is AMAZING!!! I've been coming here for YEARS. Staff is great and helpful also. I rather wait 30 minutes for my food here than go somewhere else.

rTa-vVKjajxnu5zA5UHIRg.text: Awesome and inexpensive. Tacos are huge and come with guac...abodaba and carne asada are perfect. Chips and a variety of salsas while you wait!

zHeKGCyNwTolqgjNAJQlsA.text: Rolled tacos were miserable, undercooked and soft in the middle. The avocado and cheese overwhelmed the poor things and they were not able to withstand the pressure - collapsing under their own weight. The horchata was even worse as this version tasted flowery and they decided not to add ice to the drink either. Every salsa in the place was burning butthole variety, so gringo's aren't welcome. The crowd was clearly skewed towards the spanish speaking hombres. Also, get a drive through installed, so I don't have to go inside and deal with all the drunken patrons. Oh, don't bother now, I won't be back anytime soon.

tvRZiTKr8uF3Csp7Yzi6dg.text: Green chile burrito is a real winner!  Place was packed with people from the local Mexican community who were patiently sitting out a long wait for orders. The wait was worth it in the end.  If I lived in the Tempe area I'd come here often!

FnhytlgOkvm7N9rxg95wog.text: The problem I encountered at midnight on this idle Monday night was the hunger for some Mexican food. In Colorado I have had Albertaco's, and I have had Filiberto's here in AZ, and unfortunately Poliberto's seems to be riding their coattails. The rolled tacos tasted burnt, or like the fryer oil was bad. The mixed burrito was hot, but lifeless, no flavor. They need to add salt or something. All in All, not terrible, but not for me. The salsa bar was cool, but I really wanted there to be a drive-thru. I would say, drive a little further, and get Filiberto's.

lMSQqPDZ083brx1OT4hIpw.text: Just found a traditional Mexican restaurant fast food style. The prices are very reasonable and they gave free chips and salsa! Parking can be difficult but it's worth the wait!

4YnHzWyJ48hHvl0bJoJ9bg.text: They have the best street tacos in the whole city of Tempe and the most friendliest service. This is my Sunday and Tuesday spot and they will always have my business!!!

lwbckZ_Y3koHUh9y7j7DXA.text: They must have run out of every spice except for salt and just added extra to compensate. I love salt but even this was too much. Also, diarrhea. I've since stopped eating here. Given the choice, I prefer the runs to be caused by Filiberto's rather than Poliberto's.

OprdphLtsKMPnKwZ9hJrrg.text: I love the unlimited serve yourself chips. The portions are MASSIVE and the price is perfect. The food quality is good too, one of my new favorite Mexican restaurants here in Arizona for sure.

AO5Vxx64fDh6N52CS6pPyw.text: OMG. Me and my hubby are about to move to Arizona and we followed the Reviews show on yelps. We did not got dissapointed. This place is so amazing and we loved it. Cheap, lots of food and great service. Very clean too. We already found one of our favorite places to eat once we move here.

VB71SKQnlavDVkif8NBHcA.text: YESSSSSssss! I love this place, I am able to call in orders with OLGA! salsa bar is my fave.... counter help is very helpful even if she is working alone.  Rolled Tacos supreme is a must have! they have diff items to make everyone happy.  g2g.... time to pick up my lunch!!!!   ~Rebecca G.

11eR5AqpygvaIeELKCgnAg.text: No Complaints.  Carne Asada was nicely seasoned, tortilla wrap was nice and warm with just the right amount of char on it.  I'm guessing they heated it up on the grill or some kind of press.  Fish tacos were tasty and massive.  Two very nice portions perfectly fried.  Salsa was good and not watered down.  Will be local stopping point when heading the the mall area around here.

FlZN7J6ehOYAS4sBWQ9Fbg.text: Food was good and inexpensive . I had be mini tacos in carne asada and carnitas both were excellent .

MmE63i5gMePes6tGB9w-NA.text: This place used to be awesome but now they can't even get one order right, though the menu has not changed the staff has and that makes a big difference when I think about going to Polibertos, one star because it has lost its way as  what was one of the best mexican food restaurants in Tempe.

j2-tFl6hKQxU6jGM0Ow_Ew.text: The pursuit of the guacamole burrito continues...  And now that I have moved to Tempe, I have an entirely new set of hispanic hot spots to try...especially since Poliberto's is right across the street from my new digs.  I am not seeing the shabby outside or inside that some of the reviews tout.  The building, the parking lot, the interior are all clean and well maintained.  The salsa bar is spic and span, the tables are clean and the trash is certainly not overflowing.  Even the restrooms are well maintained.  In the week I have been in Tempe, I have enjoyed Poliberto's twice.  Both times, it's with the same order:Guacamole, bacon, cheese, sour cream and onion in a tortilla...a guacamole burrito.  The price has varied both times I have ordered it...the first time $3.25, the second time $2.75.  The thickness (size) of the burrito also varied...the $3,25 version was smaller than the $2.75 version.   Maybe the day version (smaller and more expensive) is different because the temperature is higher?  We can all make adjustments because of the sun! hehehe

anaD5BHLFfIIoKuPt-nzJQ.text: I give it 4 stars only because of the service. The girls are not friendly. The wait time is long. I order my food and still have to wait atleast 15minutes or more. I love love their tacos. The meat is flavored good with a lot of meat. That's my only taco shop I go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salsa bar

TwbOrveovgx_wTPFvbe6uA.text: Their carnitas are my favorite item, the prices are great, they have a salsa bar with all you can eat chips. What's not to like about this place?

iJUB2Y4-PZWA_7_L5T79XA.text: I been here a few times and everytime I walk in I get transported to the south of the border with the smells and taste of the food. The food is amazing and the best I have had in this area. It takes awhile to order since there is only one order taker that I have seen on my visits, and just because it's popular.    I would recommend the ground beef tacos or the flautas, they are delicious. The only negative aspects of this restaurant are the booths and tables don't get wiped down fast enough for the clientele coming and going. Also, the free chips and salsa don't get refilled as often. So after dinner rush chips are gone or low and so is the salsa bar. If the staff was there to wipe down tables and fill up the salsa bar and chips this place would get a 5 stars vote from me easily.   Overall, great place for Mexican takeout.

RgSxphvLkyTw-66rMr5-uw.text: 8am on Friday morning and they're closed with no posted hours on the door.... yelp shows them as open....the advertise that they're open for breakfast... obviously not... lame!     Edit: the food is really good.. the best of the 'bertos by far... changing score... just ticked at the mis -posted hours... damn good food... just wish they wouldn't twice fry their nacho chips ... too much grease

JqfyQh-qaVP388tTWlBEAA.text: Great food and really cheap for the portion sizes. My favorite place to get Mexican take out even though it's a 20 min drive...there's a lot of other little places which are closer to me. Doesn't matter what you order - it's all good! I love the enchiladas

QSTtYCVfWf4t_zMYEIpgQQ.text: It's not the prettiest looking taqueria, but it gets the job done. Came here with a group of 10 guys after a long morning of community service after an even longer night of drinking at the bars. I made a beeline for the free chips and salsa next to the typical cucumbers and other vegetables that let you know you're in a legit taco shop.  After inhaling my first bowl of complimentary chips, we ran up to the counter starving and ordered the huge burrito with rice and beans wrapped up inside of it. I can't remember what it was called, but I do remember thinking that it was a great deal. The food came out a little slow, but the chips and cucumbers were more than enough to keep us occupied as we settled in and watched the Cardinals game on the TV.   The burritos came out and life couldn't have been any better; they blew Filiberto's burritos out of the water and just made my day. Definitely a solid taqueria option here in Tempe, and they get an extra star for the free chips and salsa.

r0a1bmR-sYEIk-dRoKDJtQ.text: I love how there's a "serve yourself" chips a salsa table set up. The table has mulitple sauces and salsa with plates and to-go containers. That was a plus since I hate nagging ppl for more.  They also offer deserts.. the last two times I went I got cheesecake since they mentioned it was made locally. The first one was better than the second cheesecake  Picture menus are great  The food needs more spice to it but I guess thats what the variety of sauces are for at the table

ORzhO-0aBpaaQYPaQ3GWog.text: I had a pretty large order of breakfast burritos that I wanted to order for my team. I tried to call in and order (5 times) and no one answered the phone. I stopped by and placed the order of 20+ breakfast burritos. The burritos were pretty good size and worth the money from that perspective, but it seemed like they were just full of egg and potato... very little meat. I know it's tough making an order like that, but take your time and treat it like it is an order for one. Did I say take your time? They definitely did that... it took about 40 min to cook the order. I don't know if that would have been a problem if I called in, but waiting in the restaurant while they cook the meal... blah One last thing that threw me off is the young lady that took my order didn't put salsa with the order, when I asked her she told me I had to go to the salsa bar and make my own. Twenty plus individual salsa containers? You want me to do that and I just spent $100? That's lame. She ended up getting me some salsa in three big containers that everyone would have to share from... I thought that was a cop out and pretty lazy. Food for thought (no pun intended) go above and beyond for your customers. It would have taken you and the cook 3 min max to fill up a variety of salsa containers.  I don't have a huge desire to go back... it won't happen in the near future. Go try it for yourself, you may have a different experience.

-irT9NmqZ4oZj7-EXVmCfg.text: I had the Camarones/Shrimp Ranch. The dish came with refried beans, rice and a lot of medium size shrimp cooked in onions, red and green peppers. This dish was medium low spicy on the heat index. It had a great fresh taste.  We arrived at 12:30pm and was able to get some of the home made salsas.  I enjoyed this meal. Seating can be limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Camarones/Shrimp Ranch, a great lunch! MrPink

BWxXylGOMc9d_thji1wnwQ.text: My favorite Mexican spot to go to when I'm in Tempe Arizona :D Their Shrimp Quesadilla is no joke!! I'm sad i didn't take a photo of it :(

4Ts6Bqck-vkqtsvNWoxpyg.text: Best burrito spot in Phoenix.  It's my secret spot.  Food portions are huge and their burritos are delicious.

dUsuWxADrGXFpbGNGYMwCQ.text: Soooo good! Born and raised in Phoenix and this is one of the best in the valley. Do not compare it to filibertos because that would be an insult. I've tried almost everything on the menu and they have yet to disappoint.

WnovzlulNRtK9N-hQgjD2A.text: Was driving to Taco Bell, drove past this place and Taco Bell was closed.   We said hey, let's give it a try. OMG it was so good. I live in Tucson. This place is a True hole in the wall, but so good.

PnE-g--C4bRv4WLILzK2Hg.text: Just go here, I'm visiting from bay area, ca and  Jesus great food at great great prices..  10 tacos outta 10 on my taco meter ... 3.50 torta and 5.49 SHRIMP AND CARNE ASADA BURRITO! ENOUGH SAID

CBxysu5IMIJYEmNdfgLcdQ.text: Excellent food and amazing prices. Food portions are h u g e. You can share most of the combos with two ppl easily. 5 dollar chimis that taste amazing. The combo chimis can feed 3 ppl easily and it's only 7bucks! All salsa is good too. Only think I wish was the place was a little bit cleaner.

a5g8bz8gk6658uW_-MmdHw.text: Top notch comida Mexicana! My buddy and I ate here and really enjoyed the fresh cooked in demand food again Fresh! Great hot chips as much as you can eat variety of salsas. The menu is very extensive, so many options we have to come back and try another combo before we leave town. Great place, very authentic.

7GddKG55DIgv5LqH9cirWg.text: Closed earlier to leave. Couldn't get food. They raced to the door to close the spores as we were about to walk in. This is the worst type of employees to have.  I would fire them at my store if they closed down even a minute early.

8lu4VyGDqEXWWR3qj7fjdg.text: I always get the carne asada burrito here when I am nearby. You can't beat the price to food ratio. The chips and several variety of salsa are great while you wait for your order.

iewBBlegAUS_ZVHdfh2hwg.text: THE...........FREEKING...........BOMB  2nd visit here today. Carne Asada burrito with just guac and pico. It was about the size of a football and I ate EVERY.......LAST.........BITE. If you're near here and looking for food, breakfast, lunch or dinner.....go here. Girl friend doesn't know what she wants to eat? Go here.  Out of all the "Berto's" in AZ, this is by far the best one.

R8adHRKg1yyr43DfVPszBA.text: Always awesome and great prices. You get enough food to make 2 meals out of 1 plate, and the average plate is around $7.50. Whenever we're in the area, we make it a point to stop here!

MEGeIhMKIBS4uEIl1ErvLA.text: Yes the chimi is big. But you can skip it. Takes forever to cook, as you start diving into it it's watery from all the onion and tomatoe inside. As far as flavor, I didn't taste any. The rice and beans were more enjoyable to eat.

YViKPO9OWSaOw3a2R7xvRQ.text: My new favorite place ever! I refuse to spend my money at any other Mexican food place! I'm sooo in love with the California burrito and all their salsas! I had it for the first time the other night and I am already craving it again!! I will be back!!

Zi-ynVM5XyhZMh2b2DCrgQ.text: I used to love this place. It was great food. My only concern used to be that they would overdo it with the cleaning chemicals and the place would smell terribly. Unfortunately, I must black list Poliberto's. They received a D on their health inspection. There are so many great Mexican food places in the Valley, why risk getting sick? (I don't think anyone actually got sick, but the risk remains.) I'd have a hard time going back even if they are able to raise their health inspection score up to an A. Again, why risk it with so many other options out there?

zMUzo-g726OABEvU5FmnkA.text: Live nearby and it's our favorite stop when we crave carne asada fries, rolled tacos, menudo and enchiladas combo! Better than most fast food choices in this area, two thumbs up!

2r-HzxKRnGXi5mIs-Wx4oQ.text: One of the BEST MEXICAN places to go around the area. If you think chipotle is good, then this isn't the place for you. Food is always cook to order and is always delicious. To top it all off the pricing is very cheap and you can buy A LOT of food for under $20. Me and my wife call this old faithful. It may get a little messy due to them being extremely busy all the time but you'll forget all about it once you take your first bite.

-ac_YoJEHCitAjBzBRoD-w.text: Thanks again Yelpers. This place was awesome! We ate here during out 5 hr layover at Phoenix. The place is walking distance from Arizona Mills mall. I ordered the chimichanga platter and my wife got the carne asada platter. It came with rice, beans and drink for around $8 each. You also get unlimited fixing bar which includes 3 kinds of salsa, fresh chips, carrots jalapeno mix, lime wedges, fresh sliced turnips and cucumbers. Fixing bar was great bc it made you feel healthy while eating a giant fried chimichanga.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. My deep fried beef chimichanga and my mouth for size reference.

OXjlRv9E-vjgK5t-3aUneQ.text: This was the second time we ordered a chimicanga and again WRONG...will never order again.

gszokub5ngJ3czW5J3efFA.text: Not fancy, but large amounts of very authentic Mexican food. Lots of locals eating here, that's how I knew it was going to be good. Not disappointed. Great prices, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great selection of authentic Mexican food at great prices.

1nPerJx63wREnIoZcfmydw.text: One of my favorite hole in the wall taco shops!  I have had roiled tacos only but they were delicious and reasonably priced!

t1I3rA0vcjtcXFjVdSnEvg.text: This place was clean , it smelled good . Like good food good , and clean good . Even the beans were awesome . Recommend the carne Asada tacos and the lemonade !

Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mexican Mexican

KAs8Ztq3gkJvG68I55Q3IA.text: This place is great! Food is cooked to order most of the time, condiment bar is good and fun and eventhough a single person works at the register or at the cooking area, food is SUPER! VERY accomodating order taker and patient, ALL of them! This Poliberto's for MEX food for me, thanks...  ( THIS, AN OLDER REVIEW BUT SEEMS THIS LOCATION STILL 100% GREAT)

5gianRvxmi_4FbZWLfl9qA.text: The food at this place tastes very authentic. They also have really good salsa, free drinks with the combos, and free chips with purchase. The only bad thing is that the decor is very old and not super clean. Very good food and its usually always pretty busy.

vbSIr7Q1W08K8RNuAid5lQ.text: Solid so far. It's great for a late night meal. The guacamole is standard here so go wild and order them all. The tacos are large and the chicken has a nice seer and flavor. The carne asada is good too and the salsas have nice flavor with a kick. It took awhile at the end of the night to get the food but I'll just say it's because they make it fresh. It seemed pretty fresh to me. I'll be back for more.

-w_wZkdmH07MrKF-S63DPw.text: Very very bad customer service. People go in there to spend their money and should be treated well. These girls working here are very rude and act like they don't want you there.

N5EZ_apIKO4QxTr_hJvVww.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  It's called Poliberto's Taco Shop, so get the tacos.  They compare well to tacos around the Valley.  Street-style, simply done, well-seasoned without being too salty, good salsa, decent heat.  This place is legit.  A lot of places got rid of their cabeza tacos, not here, and they are great.  Stewed and soft but still with some chew.  Next time I go, I have to ask which parts of the head they use with the hope that they use all of it.  Eyeballs and all.  I've also had their carne asada, carnitas, and lengua.  The lengua is great, as is the carnitas.  I liked the carne asada the least of the three here, but their carne asada is better than Los Taquitos.  It's a solid carne asada, just not the best.  But, based on the quality of the their other tacos, coupled with the fact that they still serve cabeza, this taqueria still deserves its 4 stars.

zIKiAaitvPxTV6efoZaOGg.text: As a Mexican, this is what I call authentic Mexican food!  It's absolutely delicious!  I had the 3 mini tacos made with carne asada and a side of rice and beans.  Paid $7.49 for all of that plus a drink.  Had the horchata!  Two thumbs up for sure!

CmS8bxYrt-vdhj5pj3qCcw.text: Great homemade Mexican food! Tastes like home (Tucson, Az). The food is freshly made to order and the salsa is great. Enchiladas are pretty dang good too. We will be back! Can't wait to try the breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Barbacoa burro!

qJXAYrt4y4HJ76uuRXU0rw.text: I got to know this small chain from another location so if is shocking to me to write this review. I love, love Polibertos. This location is terrible. Each time we have gone there (a total of three separate times) we have waited at least 30 minutes for our order. This last time I came by, the restaurant was filthy. If I had hadn't had the food before, I would have walked right out. We must have waited 45 minutes for two tacos and beans and couldn't find a place to sit because of how dirty it was. Never coming back.

btDHI5v-lQens0BEGXou7Q.text: Free chip and salsa bar, what's not to like?! Came here on a Friday night at 9PM and there were a lot of people ordering food still. I took about 20 mins for a lengua and California burrito, which is kinda long, but they seemed to only have 2 people working there. Their prices are pretty affordable it was only $11 and  change for the 2 burritos and they were big and they didn't skimp on the meat. Will be back again when the Mexican food cravings hit.

zxohNTP5__xaCdZVgBBRXA.text: I've been to 'the 'berto's all over the Southwest .. this is  One of THE BEST~!  The food is consistently Tasty.  Seems to be always Busy and you may think service is 'slow' but Hey.. they are Busy~! That's a good thing.. ~! Try it for yourself.. it's not fine dining.. it's not Hip or a millennial joint.. it's A Good Local Mexican Spot to grab some good Eats. Big Portions and the Carne Is really tender and moist.. It's worth the few minute wait you may have to endure for some really good Mexican food .

PVyrjCip7yTR1zoxCNa3Hg.text: The only negative I found was it took a little while to get the food.   Now on to the positives:  Great salsa bar. Good choices of salsa, pickled carrots and jalapenos, sliced cucumbers and free chips.   The food was delish. The rolled tacos were tasty with a huge amount of guacamole and cheese. I had the cabeza gigantico burrito, the meat had a great flavor and texture, I tried the pollo burrito as well, and I can say that it was some of the best tasting pollo I have had in a long time.   The prices are great too, burritos for under 5.  I will definitely be coming back the next time I come back to Phoenix.

LqfgdHUaKR-PKeEW5r-qQA.text: Great food at even better prices. Especially compared to all the competition around, their food is bomb. They don't have a drive thru but I've never had a problem getting out of the car. Also where most places only have red and green, they have 4 salsas to choose from. Which makes the experience even better. Plus Everytime I've been there, there has been the most beautiful and kind lady working the counter. And when someone greets you with a smile, it makes the food taste better. And I think that's been scientifically proven!

fT8MuLb7KFOXT5ocTgsiBg.text: This is the closest place to my house that offers decent menudo. It's awesome and spicy and rich! They have a decent salsa bar, and chips which is a bonus. They're carne asada is delicious, but sometimes their portions are a little more sparser than others. All in all good Mexican food from someone that's picky about it.

dSWrUjOBdN8C3_OE8XGC2w.text: Seriosuly good carne asada. Shredded beef and shrimp tacos were also very very good.my only issue is price... for 6 tacos and a side of beans, the bill was $22... I can spend 10 bucks at some other local taco spots and get just as good if not a bit better..

pnoO3pzpCoiKaqCOQGRAbw.text: Food here is so great always served hot when I order it and a good portion for your money. Can be packed around Friday evenings and Saturdays but it's worth it recommend it to anyone looking for some good food to cure the hangovers!

SfIb1UzgFGE1I9XK-Q7smw.text: Honestly I'm giving this restaurant 5 stars, because it has never disappointed me. My family and I come here every weekend to enjoy a delicious meal such as carne asada fries and we'll never cheat on this place. The staff is always friendly and they are always sure that you are both comfortable and satisfied with the service. It is obviously not Mexico street taco taste, but compared to filibertos and all these taco shops, I can definitely say that is if not the best, one of the best Mexican food places in the valley!

7edYlJ9cpWBERzd1jNrp3w.text: Pretty good food I thought as well as supported by its popularity--no available seating. But stars subtracted for the lack of cleanliness of the restaurant itself.

F7EMmutJcPFtO4_EUPHGtQ.text: very popular place, not the fastest service but food is good, cheap and authentic Mexican. Free salsa/chips service yourself at the front - great salsa! Not in the nicest area of Phoenix but whose complaining? I'd say if you're in the mood for good, cheap Mexican food you can't go wrong here.

T7OkA9apLOn7PXj5SsWbFw.text: This place is very dirty. The employees do a poor job of keeping the dining area clean. I ordered from the menu anyways and ended up getting food poisoning. I will never go back to this place. I think a health inspector should visit.

VfaJ1JWGJKCS86WmepcgNw.text: fantastic food, oustanding prices, and one of the best salsa bars in town - realize that your eyes WILL be too big for your stomach, so be sure to tip when you get your to-go boxes!  The carne asada fries were legit, the chimichanga was out of this world and the shrimp quesadilla made me miss the beach it was so fresh.  This is by far my favorite 'berto in the valley!

q66SNvKuaWrG5mI5_IDr3A.text: I went to this restaurant to order a half order of super nachos. After I got through approximately half of them,  I found a black pubic hair with the root still attached. It indicated that it may have been placed in my food on purpose. Even if it wasn't, I'm so disgusted that I'll never eat there again. And I'm so disappointed because I really like their food. This happened on Tuesday, August 18, 2015. I don't know if a health inspector has visited, but after my bad experience, I have to question whether one should visit there. It's obvious that washing hands and wearing gloves aren't top priority. I just hope I don't get sick from this.

Xs84K7jIexqdFY8xs9Z4hA.text: I love small taco shops like I'm used to in San Diego been here in Phoenix for 2 years and looking for the right taco shop. Well this is gotta be it. I don't see how they can make such good food for so small prices. Their chili rellenos are the best of any restaurant I've had here in Phoenix their shrimp cocktail is fantastic and the breakfast chorizo burrito is out of this world I live directly across from a taco shop on Southern but I come all the way over here now.

1bL94b9DURNuzpCbsOcgbQ.text: First time to eat there, experience was horrible. Casher had no flexibility at all, Cashier were  unable to change my order to cevichetwo minutes after placing it. Cashier added that she will provide a small sample to try. We received our order but the ceviche is still being worked on as the cashier indicated. I asked again after a good 20 minutes , she said "they are still chopping it". Ordered shrimp quesadilla, shrimp was very rubbery with half way cooked huge chunks of tomatoes, onions and green peppers just not pleasant to eat.  We left and the poor cook was still chopping the ceviche..

wbDeBLGNkXzkiI941gjKmA.text: I love it. Great for vegans, great for raw foodists, great for raw vegans..   They make the salad just the way you want it....no meat, no cheese, not cooked. Fresh. Delicious. Fast. Friendly.

Yt4PAewPmus398OLXGVaeA.text: Totally agree with the rest of the reviewers about this being the usual greasy, meat-heavy Mexican restaurant with no frills, but soul-satisfying stomach-filling food. If you're on a diet or if you're the lettuce-eating, fat-free-everything types, you'd do best to steer clear of Poliberto's--everything is unabashedly huge and dripping in lard here. I wanted to get the three tacos combo, but since I'm a recent beef-eater, I couldn't stomach the description of tongue and beef head being included in the tacos. Though I figure it must be tasty :P  Anyway, I got the chicken taco and the carne asada taco and got plenty of lemon wedges and salsa. The tacos were huge. The asada was more delicious than the chicken. The chicken came topped with lettuce and shredded cheese and had a hard shell, which I was definitely not expecting, and didn't like. Other than that...Ok to eat at when you're hungry and want to save a buck.

Dfu-vEIYhrWRahRPsSvrXw.text: I went here due to the positive reviews on Yelp- I'm from out of town and walked here from my hotel. Great food! I waited about 10 minutes- which is great for made to order food! It's a bit of a hole in the wall, but don't let that stop you from going! Great prices too.

9XIC3q6Rt2WVBvtMBq0BEw.text: Living in the apartment complex next to this place is the definition of convenience. Polibertos is a family Mexican shop that brings a little slice of Mexico to the States. Don't confuse them in relation to filibertos or any other Bertos. This shop does it right. Prices are great, takes a little time to get out to you, however the portion size is exceptional for the price. The taco bar is always stocked with free chips, salsa, limes, and lemons. The atmosphere is like a little slice of Mexico, very refreshing. Haven't been disappointed yet!

cn3_E62LbtFRvc9WEiEDnw.text: Appealing when you pull up,not so much.(THE BUILDING THAT IS) The food is awesome and plenty of fresh food for the price. Decent chips n salsa bar for free,when you order sumin. The salsa is very good. The atmosphere inside is o.k. but what do you expect this isn't the Ritz... Kinda an old school setting for a taco shop. There is plenty of items to order and you will certainly find sumin to your liking in this taco shop. The food is fresh and very good. If you have tryed it in the past and didn't like sumin, I suggest trying sumin else. The food is excellent and decent quantity for the price. I see sum people have given two stars,this is a four star or better in my book.              Maybe they had bad experience,who knows..I know, it's good food 4 shore! Price is right, location is good, food is excellent, large menu selection too choose from, unlike FiLLi B's... Way better menu selection to choose from then your typical FiLLi B's restaurant. Tell me, when is the last time you got a burger at FiLLi B's???? You can't! You can at Poliberto's taco shop,Mexican style burger of course. Good too!!             The funny thing is at: Poliberto's Taco Shop.. Next time you go in there watch all the free loaders, load up at the Salsa bar.. You would think they never ate or had Salsa&Chips for a long time. People always free loading on free chips,cucumbers,carrots and loading up, like there never gonna eat again. You pay for that kinda stuff at FiLLi B's...Comical to watch the leeches load up at the salsa bar..... I'm sure the free loaders are the ones that give two stars. The people I see loading up at the salsa bar n taking enough for 7 people is the other reason I like to go and people watch.... The nerve of sum people.... two stars and then loading up on free stuff. JaJaJaJaJaJa HaHaHa

jkb9Ly0F_OcP_BMdK0Z3Ag.text: Pollo adobado is great. It may be a little dirty but it is great cheap Mexican and the food is always worth it. Plus they are open late

0QEQ656i7Qum2SCxwxojjw.text: I love poliburtos. Compared to filiburtos they are 100x better. Everything I've ever eaten There is amazing. I would recommend this place over any small Mexican food restaurant around. Yummmm

oIynY7dw-NzizjReQfGw6w.text: The food was good. I purchased the California burrito and it was delicious. It wasn't great but it was good enough to make me want to come back and try something different. I came with a buddy and he purchased the ranchero steak plate which looked good. Only reason I'm deducting two stars is because there are too many flies in the restaurant. We couldn't eat in peace without a swarm of flies harrasing us . And the men's restroom didn't have any soap to wash hands with. Yikes .

gYSncl4Jqs6szGA-zsT4lg.text: The food is delicious and the servings are generous, just wished it had a drive through

rZ-AUqiweOo5BNbRsDKZCQ.text: It was good, I ordered the chorizo tacos and they were good, but I also ordered horchata and that was the fake kind from a package, not so good... and I also ordered the

ldzDZh9CBxkXLGqGYxEtug.text: My husband and I have driven past this place a million times and have wanted to try it. So for our date afternoon we went here. We walked in and the place was disgusting filthy. There lil "salad"bar was covered in food there was trash and food all over the floor. It was nasty. Needless to say we didn't bother eating we turned and walked right back out the door.

i_IHe3qw-dGxc3mFsTMi9g.text: Fantastic made to order food. Cheap and big plates. Salsa bar. Everything we ordered was really good and tasty.  It's filibertos but better.  -Only con was the parents who let their kids lay on the table top with his shoes and diaper at 10pm at night but it's not the restaurants fault that some of their customers should've been spaded and neutered before they could have kids.

gg9nV4-r1Q2hH0OzbxW_wA.text: This place probably has good food, so I gave it 4 stars. I'm vegan and came here because some reviews said the beans were made with vegetable oil. This is not True. The beans are cooked with lard. Meat eaters, enjoy, but vegans should go elsewhere.

rvqISimYZpW-4oPlth0j6w.text: Polibertos is located on baseline just east of the 10. I don't know how I just recently found out about this place but it is incredibly affordable with a ton of extras. They have a full salsa bar with four different types of sauces and salsa as well as fresh cucumbers and peppers with carrots. Fresh chips keep people happy while their food is cooked. Order a combo and you get a free beverage. Hours are great... They open early and stay open very late!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States

UeAD0Nq7IcOCSZ6ZaKEoNg.text: Just finished trying the cheese enchiladas, my husband had the chimichanga burrito enchilada style, and my daughter had the rolled tacos with beef and I must say, it was absolutely delicious! We also had the horchata which was equally amazing. Everything was right under 30 bucks and we even got 3 churros. We will be back. Looks like we found another place.

6RnmwA4BG2cksGv-vRVW9Q.text: I've been to Polibertos once before as a dine-in customer and ordered a marinated grilled chicken burrito from the specials menu, it was a generous portion and well seasoned.  I worked up a craving for meat during a late night work out and made my way in maybe a little after 11:30. Despite there being only one person ahead of my order, I had to wait in the lobby for about 15 minutes. Not a problem, they probably had to take out a new piece of steak for my burrito supreme. I waited patiently and enjoyed their salsa bar and complimentary chips.  The take-out container seemed very heavy so I was optimistic that perhaps I got the late night hookup. I opened my container when I got home and was shocked. The burrito while generously filled was filled with 98% steak fat! Every piece of meat in the burrito was too fatty to eat. I heard some laughing in the kitchen during my prep time so perhaps they were playing a joke on me. That or they thought that because I put in a to-go order so late I wouldn't be back in to return it. They were wrong! I came back in with the receipt and the food to show them the disgusting mess they served me. The cashier quickly handed me $5.50 from the register and I went on my way.   After looking at the receipt my total with tax was $6.48. You can keep the 98cents I won't be back. I somewhat feel this was racially motivated as well but have no proof of that. I just had to get this review typed up before I go to bed. Hungry.

qVwSYa-zbN5iKpVIUzET-A.text: You can't beat their prices and how much food you get. My eyes were bigger than my stomach   I got two items for under $10 with a tip

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chorizo torta and supreme burrito

HyMuNuAII1A7FPftTWJfVQ.text: I really enjoy this place! It's cheap authentic Mexican food that hits the spot! Staff are friendly and the place is alright inside kinda dingy. We usually bring the food home instead of eating there. The green chile carnitas meal is great with a large Horchata! The tortillas that come with the meal are warm and yummy! Their shrimp cocktail is great too (FYI: Mexican version is not just cocktail sauce and shrimp!). I'm getting hungry just writing this review ! All in all, great place to go when you want a cheap bite!

cmnxCO9SZLAUrRa3vqC7MA.text: I have been here a multiple times and each time, I have to say the food is fresh and delicious.  They always make it exactly how I ask and have never had a mistake.  They have a few different salsa options and fresh chips sitting out for you to help yourself.  They are pretty reasonably priced for the quantity of food you get (which can be a lot).  And they stay pretty busy, so they are doing something right.  The only reason I did not give it five stars, is the customer service is very average. They are pretty transactional and don't really ask how you are doing or anything when you come in.  But to be honest, I don't care all that much.  I just like their food and they are close.  Also they stay open late which is very nice!

UrG1NonfBiPSxVsdhMIKzQ.text: Not much to look at, probably was a Wendy's or some other fast food restaurant in a former life.  The menu features lots of choices of burritos, tacos and combination plates.  Order from the not so flattering pictoral menu posted above the counter.  All the food is prepared fresh so grab some chips and salsa (three varieties) while you wait for your order to be called. Ours took about 10 minutes.    Food is fresh, hot and inexpensive. Lunch for the three of us was just under $20 total. I had a combination plate with a shredded chicken burrito, crispy chicken taco and it came with rice and beans -tons of food-only $6.99.  Lots of everyday people stopping in for lunch. Decent and filling chow.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Simple inside

AKRIxb3EjvfBzoDn6X01vg.text: This place goes in and out of being excessively busy all within 30 minute time slots. It's weird and I couldn't really understand why that was happening. When we arrived the line was very long and there was quite a few people helping themselves to a ridiculous amount of "to go" salsa, cucumbers, carrots, and limes. The tables were all dirty.  There were some gangster type cholos in the parking lot and some people inside we're a bit sketchy. The menu has a lot of variety and some great specials were written on a paper by the cashier. Very friendly staff. It took about 18 minutes from when we ordered to one we got our food. In the time that we were there they refilled the salsa bar and free chips. By the time we were leaving the place was completely clean, filled with Middle Eastern, black, Asian, and typical white guys....meaning this place appeals to all!

cf2FQ5SM3y-yiN1e5bUwZg.text: Mexican at its best! Large portions, good prices & tasty! We dined in and it was clean and I wasn't uncomfortable so that was a plus!! The chimichangas were huge, lots of meat. My daughter who is 3 ate the refried beans by itself. My 1 year old son ate the rice. Definitely would return!!

The only one thing i would say to make this a far star review is to have the cashiers smile a little More. I really don't care if they do or don't however I would have rated this a 5 if they did. With all that being said I still find this place delicious and again you get what you pay for solid quality food for the price.

cQokBo9xj-mSsclU7lSe3w.text: 2.5 stars acutally because it seems the meat is fresher if you go in before 3 pm after that you might get the shits or not . Service is not the best the cashiers seem like they hate the job and Just want to run out .

rMBH5oLXtzXO-Q22_L1JnQ.text: I really wanted to like this place more than I did! The first thing I noticed after ordering and looking for a place to sit was that nearly every table was dirty with crumbs, sauce, straw wrappers, etc. The floor wasn't looking too hot either. It was near closing so I know people were in and out all day, but felt it should've been cleaner. I ordered the chicken chimichanga. The prices here can't be beat, and the portion size was insane. I wasn't expecting to get that much food for how little I spent so I was definitely stoked on that. However something just didn't taste right. The chicken had basically no flavor and it didn't sit right with me after I took a few bites. The rice and beans were good, and I enjoyed all the different salsas they offer. I plan on giving this place another shot, most likely with a different menu item.

oTAVLEsXVMPmQ_WxNQbwcQ.text: Poliberto's is hard to miss, it's located on Baseline Road and has flashing neon lights. Their menu is huuuge - they have all sorts of different options for burritos, chimichangas, tacos, breakfasts, quesadillas, and more! Everything I've tried so far has been fantastic and I'm always looking forward to going back and trying more of their items. I also really like that they offer both regular tacos and street tacos (slightly smaller).   They have their own chips and salsa bar which is something really unique for this kind of restaurant and it is definitely appreciated! They have both plates and plastic sandwich bags so that you're able to take advantage of it whether you're dining in or taking to go.   The only downside is that sometimes you have to wait a bit to get your food, but it has yet to be bad enough where I won't want to return.

6eBv4d7cTlWQmgKtS8frfg.text: I had previously bookmarked this taco shop.  We happened to drive nearby and decided to dive-in.  What a find!  Looking at the outside alone isn't inviting so l am thanful to our Yelp community for reviewing places such as Poliberto's.  This is an outstanding Mexican restaurant with an extensive menu sure to please all palates.  Of course l can rave all day about their enormous portions and modest prices because that's the truth! I had a veggie burrito enchilada style with a small horchata drink, Ron had two chicken tacos.  Our total bill was $11.40.  My veggie burrito was stuffed with rice, beans, cheese, avocado, cream and shredded lettuce. The tortilla tastes super fresh. It was absolutely simple and delicious.  Ron's chicken taco looked crispy and was filled all the way up. Their free salad includes tangy carrots, more lettuce, lemons, assorted salsa & sauces, warm chips and pickles. The locals eat here, families have their Sunday brunch to enjoy a quiet time together.  There is a TV rolling infomercials in Spanish as a mild background noise.  There were lots of kids and all were extremely well-behaved. All were eating nearly and there was no trash on  the tables or on the floor. It was refreshing to be at Poliberto's to see families sharing time together instead of cel phones. We had a great lunch and will be back for both the food and the humane experience.  Thank you Poliberto's!

The chimichangas are delicious, the carne asada fries and rolled tacos are sooooo good, and everything else I've ever tried has been great.  The people at the counter are always incredibly friendly and patient, even when it's late and you have no idea what you want.  They always have a poppin' crowd late at night, but the food is always quick and delicious!

n83hyULq4TFpTldvL5ENTA.text: Very good. Go for the mini tacos over the regular size tacos as the tortilla taste if not home made then definitely bough from a great Mexican tortilla shop. Simple taco joint that packs lots of flavor. Love the spread of chips,salsas,edible radishes,cucumbers and spicy carrots and jalapenos. They make the food fresh when you order it, so we prefer to call in our orders ahead of time and take it to-go. I have never ordered anything that wasn't good, but my personal favorite is the beef fajita plate. My husband's favorite is the steak and shrimp burrito. One of my all time favorite places to eat.

0HlkNba1Anm_CRpGsZbH1Q.text: I think the food here is pretty much five stars. They have four different salsas and they are all really good. The only thing that kept me from posting this as five stars was the atmosphere is not the greatest. But their prices are inexpensive so I guess I'd rather save the money then spend it on atmosphere.

nG6EwNkxFD1gvQb85b22HQ.text: Well, the name makes it sound like about 1,000 other Mexican restaurants in the Valley.  But I had some friends in town and wanted to take them somewhere that had solid food so I listened to Yelp . . . and I was not disappointed.  Definitely worth a visit and the food is several notches above the average place that ends in some form of "berto"!

UfHDrNYHTJXocpEpSrF-fw.text: After reading the reviews for Poliberto's and trying it for myself I honestly cannot see what all the hype is about. My chicken burrito was unexciting in that it was only a massive amount of chicken wrapped in a flour tortilla, no toppings or sauce to speak of, and as if that weren't enough the chicken was borderline inedible. It was essentially like tasting a salt lick. And this is not just my disappointed opinion I had two of the people I live with try it for themselves and they agreed that it was gross. The steak tacos were somewhat redeeming but the steak was also slightly on the salty side and a little dry. Also the cheese that they were using to top the tacos tasted like shredded craft American cheese. With so many other options nearby I doubt that I will be back.

Un48hfXnumZ7RpVscTiT1w.text: It was a late night while my bf and I were in Arizona. We decided to look up some Mexican food joints and came across this one on Yelp. The reason I wanted to go here was because the carne asada tacos look bomb! So we went and I ordered carne asada tacos and the New Sonoran Taquitos (2 for $3.99). The carne asada tacos were so good! The meat was just okay, but what really made this great were the toppings (guacamole, pico de gallo and a bit of cilantro). When ordering the Taquitos, I was expecting it to come rolled. It looked just like a taco but with a pan fried tortilla base. The Taquitos contained grilled onions, lettuce and guacamole; I really enjoyed this one! In addition to those items, we also ordered 2 breakfast burritos (although one was for the next morning). The steak and egg burritos with potatoes were on point; the chorizo wasn't. I would order everything I got again except for the chorizo breakfast burrito.   Loved the salsa and chips bar. The red sauce was better than the green, which was a bit bitter. If it wasn't for the slow service and the fact that everyone that ordered after us got their food first, I would have given 5 stars. Better luck next time .   Review 79/100 for 2016

EsimDUn_nvcQAAGeea1ZAA.text: One of my favorite Bertos.  Customer service is good. This place is always busy which is a good thing

clAsd6-MKVv8T7NhTiEpRg.text: I grew up on the north side of Phoenix and moved away for about 10 years and was back for a quick visit. Honestly priority #1 was to get an authentic carne asada burrito with guac and green salsa because they just aren't done right anywhere else. Anyway I was literally counting down the days until my trip to eat this burrito and when I landed Poliberto's was close and the style of food I was looking for. They did not disappoint. It was perfectly seasoned and every single bite was exactly what I'd remembered and I sat in that booth with that burrito making weird satisfied noises while I ate. I would have bought a case and shipped them back home if that was possible. They have chips and salsa at the counter for free too, I wasn't sad about that. Who cares about decor at a tiny burrito place like this? It's about the food not the pictures on the walls. A bit of a line and a wait but it was less than 5 min if I'm remembering correctly. Some tables were dirty but the cashier woman came and cleaned them when there wasn't a line so maybe they were understaffed that day. I've been back home for a while now and writing this review has made me really hungry and so sad I can't get this burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States

GMMnFaeoQh-KFWLG4iEp-Q.text: I like to to express how much I love Poliberto's . Everytime I order take out . Everything is fresh & crispy . And Poliberto's is family owned . They are curteous & friendly & helpful . I will always go back there to take out orders . To me their #1 in mexican meals .

rA_CSjsRWcnvFoRbZNwm0g.text: fast service, cool employees that are helpful, gigantic menu, good late hours. hard to go wrong here

xSctE9i3w8VcFdxBbhv4fA.text: Most of the food consumed at a 'bertos is like bad sex.  It's cheap, dirty, and leaves you with a burning sensation the next day.  But fear not, gentle readers, I come bearing a message of hope. Not all 'bertos are created equal.  I used to live down the street from Poliberto's when it was Happy China Buffet, but never ventured into the dingy beige joint.  Then they went and added some electric yellow paint and garish red trim and for some reason it drew me in like a skeeter to a bug zapper.  There wasn't a drive-up here, only take out or dine-in, and the place was packed with my people.  Us poor unfortunates that work outside all day, covered in sweat, dirt, and godknowswhat.  So I figured it was a sign of some sort.  And I was right.  The carnitas were tender and crispy, the guacamole was flavorful and chunky and there were about five different types of salsa for me to measure the mettle of my taste buds against.  It's cheap as sin but doesn't leave me with that seedy, slightly used feeling the next morning.  Give it a whirl if you feel like your lard quotient for the week needs to be met.  It's a step up from Fili-B's fare.

ZECDqob5YBLuXqsrHGiHdw.text: All 'berto's are, in fact, NOT created equal.  My ex-girlfriend and I used to be fans of Filiberto's, but the customer service was HORRIBLE.  The cashiers taking our food orders, got the order incorrect about 90% of the time.  My ex  was vegan (which made me vegan, by default, whenever I'm eating with her).  One of my ex's coworkers recommended Poliberto's to us, and we have loved it, ever since.  I am a very loyal fan and a frequent customer!  My ex loves to get the bean burrito, with guacamole, and cilantro.  The refried beans are made with vegetable oil (and NOT lard).  Plenty of free chips, and a great selection of different salsa's at the salsa bar.  It has the typical Coca-Cola selection of fountain drinks, and some other more traditional Mexican drinks too...  Poliberto's cashiers have NEVER gotten our food order wrong!  Unlike the 90% of the cashiers at Filiberto's who give the cooks the wrong order (typically with cheese), when we had specifically asked for NO cheese.  Be careful if you order the Guacamole and chips!  The Guacamole always come with cheese on it, unless you specifically ask for NO cheese, then Poliberto's cooks will just give you more Guacamole instead, with the chips.  Eating at Poliberto's has ALWAYS been an excellent experience!  5+ stars!

8EPJ8BbmQgEsNd8ip9GBcA.text: Everyone thinks im talking about the other abomination of a restaurant when I tell them about this place.  The only similarities are the menu and the name.  The food is very tasty and its super cheap on top of it.   I get the green chili burrito and its the best burrito I've had in this part of town.   For $4 you cant beat it.  They even have menudo on the weekends and the shrimp cocktail is great too.

sG9lNdO8Uvk8ZAhZVnKlBw.text: Ok, first off, they have probably some of the best Steak Ranchero I've ever tasted!!  So yummy!  The salsa is way better than any other "berto's" out there, infact they have a salsa bar.  It's good price for what you get.   Best part of it all is!  THEY SPEAK ENGLISH!!  I mean you can actually understand them.

OUSo_sFEU4RvHhN54p_tCQ.text: Food is greasy and not great.  Salsa is good though.  Has a dirty feeling to it.  Bring some hand sanitizer, lots of gross mitts on the salsa trough ladles.  On the upside you get a lot of food and it's cheap, just don't expect it to be good.

TAEEJfTXkZ6dLIMPSx7spA.text: Best fast food Mexican place I have been to in the Phoenix area.  Menu has great variety and their Salsa is damn good.  Go here instead of Fili B's!  So far I haven't ordered anything that I don't like.  The restaurant is fairly clean for a fast food establishment that is busy during all hours of the day/night.  Food takes a little while to cook but is well worth the wait.

ax6QeNQL86-9Sq9WSLWxJw.text: Yes, I'm addicted to anything that ends in ***bertos, and although I'm not hispanic, I seem to have acquired a serious taste for this kind of food.   This was my first time here, and I was expecting a drive-thru as most of these places have but did not mind having to go inside to order.  It definitely has that cheap/fast/authentic mexican vibe with bright colors and a big picture menu.  The fact that I was the only white chick in the place made me feel confidant that I would not be disappointed.    I opted for the green chile burrito which was delicious...smaller chunks of pork than I'm used to with more of a kick than I was expecting and a perfectly hot and chewy tortilla.  Nice selections at the salsa bar and decent service.  Definitely a solid four stars.

gmnPGu1g9qcBQUUxme-GtA.text: I went there couple of times and I loved the food. I love the bar where we get Salsa and Chips. Only was bad is the waiting which is something in Mexican food. They make awesome for us and I would wait.

7qkBVirIzKRdT82PXcUbQQ.text: Decent rolled tacos.  Loved the salsa.  Pleasantly surprised.

yNkixOtvzq_BqcE_iFX81g.text: This place is entirely what you would expect: okay fast mexican food at a reasonable price and nothing more.

Lu7kfUszpVY6n8clX76dIA.text: i love the food here the beans and rice have amazing flavor. i've been going here for years i love this place. i use to live in phoenix and the drive here was always more than worth it. this is my top spot for the phoenix area for mexican food. the salsa is super super amazing in every way. if i could rate this place higher i would. prices here are great always. i now live in fresno,ca and great food like this is hard to find !! if you do find good food here it won't be consistent and cheap trust me been looking for two years now. anyways i highly recommend poliberto's to any and all who like great food. 5 stars isn't high enough..

vjtn0wmmE_AuqsOQc3Pylg.text: I absolutely love this place.  It beats filibertos hands down.  The prices are great and the food is excellent.  I usually get either the rolled tacos with guac & cheese, or the chili relleno burrito filled with carnitas.  The latter being a particular favorite.  I've also had the deluxe nachos with carne asada, which are also quite delicious.  They have a great salsa bar and a large bin of fresh tortilla chips.  Sometimes the chips are in low supply, but I usually go later at night.  The staff normally consists of a single girl working the counter, but she is very sweet.  I can't recommend this place enough.

v3g02KZTRmoctQL56etMZA.text: Any place that ends in "berto" is good.

1brTEwt2FwfHTbVxGb-e2A.text: Usually the food is pretty good. Probably been there about 10 times in the year. The supreme quesadilla is pretty good (especially if you order the sour cream and guaca on the side instead of inside the quesadilla), the burritos are average and so are the breakfast burritos, although you should not come here if you are starving, usually takes 15 mins or longer to cook.

ApEw5LGPrd3TB5Pqp49x9w.text: not sure if it's fair to compare it with Filiberto's, but it's much better and I believe a little cheaper

hg6lm6x1OHPJ8_b915E8hg.text: Ok....Lemme let you in on a little secret...If there are quite a bit of Mexicans grubbing down in Mexican food restaraunt...it's probably a good place....I should know...I'm Mexican. Now with that being said, being on vacation I thought this place was OK. First time I went in I had a Chorizo & Egg burrito. It was freaking huge. The eggs weren't all greasy & runny like some Mexican dive places and the chorizo was NOT greasy at all. Took it into the Giants game and people next to me were like, " where did you get that?" Not at the baseball game my friend! Second time took a Carne Asada burrito w/ me to the Dodger game, the meat was tender and tasted great. I don't know if they do this w/ all their meat burritos, but they threw in some guacamole (& with the salsa I threw in) made it slammin'. Nothing better than a good buritto and a cold beer @ the ball yard!

A5FAbCtt4UoLR0oNHfCkmg.text: i do like the food but, today at 9 pm  the cashier gave the worst service. the sauce bar was empty and place was a mess. when we. asked for sauce the cashier rolled eyes . she acted like she hated her job. persons like that shouldnt work for resturants. there was other customers ther too that she ga additude. i normally go too poli's 3 times a week .but if this girl is not told how to treat customers it will probably be the last.

neIJ2goXGm5qcp2myytg3g.text: This place is amazing. I was so impressed with the food on the first try that I decided to go back the next day. During the two day adventures the family and I tried the carne asada tacos which came with pico de gallo and guacamole, shrimp tacos which are huge, carne asada fries, super nachos, rolled tacos with cheese and guacamole on top , carne asada torta, and a steak burrito. The tacos are served on homemade tortillas which are super good. They have free chips and a salsa bar. We are so happy that we found this place on our visit to the Phoenix area.   FYI...If you go for lunch, the line can be long but the staff is really good at moving the line along.

xdqHL_Z5mO4NLoxG1hPqEQ.text: Authentic.  Inexpensive.  Fast.  Nothing else needs to be said.  Mexican food perfection.  The kind of place I wish they had in Northern California.  Never know why people want to pay $20-30 entrees when a place like this is so much better.  Shredded beef tacos recommended.

8XFyPG_OXVQ0UAeAs0VP_g.text: Was good caldo de res when I was theres, but the one i ordered to go came w no potatoes or corn just carrots.  Tried calling....no answer...

edudzdwxkSoTnQMcA--5YA.text: Prologue: My fiancee and I wanted to find some good Mexican food for our Saturday evening dinner date. I had recently read some good reviews about this restaurant and we decided we had to give it a try.  The Plot: We shared a Shrimp Cocktail, a Chimichanga Combination Plate (stuffed with shredded beef), and a Mini Taco Combination Plate (including a Chicken Taco, Fish Taco, and Steak Taco). We also helped ourselves to some of the customary self-serve condiments (sliced cucumbers, pickled jalapenos, onions, and carrots, and four different salsas) as well as some tortilla chips, of course.  The Scene: The overall appearance of this restaurant is completely consistent with your standard taqueria. However, the first important difference we noticed when we arrive is the relatively extensive menu, which offers nearly 30 different combination plates along with several a la carte items in each of the traditional categories.  The next important difference was the portion sizes relative to the price and the quality of the ingredients. The large goblet in which the Shrimp Cocktail was served was filled to the brim with shrimp that was very fresh tasting and garnished with chopped avocado. The Chimichanga was huge, plenty for two people, and filled with shredded beef that was tender, flavorful, and juicy. The Mini Tacos were made with two corn tortillas each and filled with more of the meats than regular size tacos along with the usual seasonings and toppings. The consistency of sides was perfect and the refried beans were exceptionally tasty.  The Rest of the Story: The staff were friendly and courteous, the prices were very reasonable (the Shrimp Cocktail, in particular, was a great deal). The wait was no more than about 10 minutes and we had no trouble getting a table right after we arrived at approximately 7pm on a Saturday evening.  Epilogue: This location is now our top choice for taquerias in our area.  Photo Design By: Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Cocktail, Chimichanga Combination Plate, and Mini Taco Combination Plate

Kcuu2_vBdzX8jo28mmt4qw.text: This is the Best Mexican food around! This is the Beef Chimichanga, and Chicken Flautas, complete with beans & rice, chips & salsa, veggies, and Horchata to drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Flautas, Chimichanga with beans &amp; rice, chips &amp; salsas, veggies,  Horchata

LyGevkCX8UaLumioyrn-Yg.text: This place is great home style Mexican food will definitely keep coming back as much as possible. Their selection is fairly large and the customer service is good too. The portions are very large for the price. You definitely have to give them a try!

AgZbggB15y-ihoAPVJGzBg.text: You get exactly what you pay for! Prices are reasonable and the portions are very filling and very generous! I recommend the beef tacos with guacamole!!! BEST IVE HAD SINCE I LIVED IN CALIFORNIA!!! Definitely coming back! Love the flavors. Everything is made to order and you can definitely taste it! The salsa bar is superb and their pickled carrots are OMG! And I'm not exaggerating! I have a complex and very Sophisticated pallet and this place is just perfect for that Rough Mexican/America antojitos.

PDSs3NBJQoXMOCyLO8_S6g.text: Unexpected spot that I've driven by dozens of time but never thought to stop in and give a try. Postgame dinner we decided to head over as it was late (after 8pm). From the outside I thought another Filbertos but it's different.   If u can't park when u first pull in just follow it around like a drive-thru and parking is on the other side... ignore the houses if u can but they almost seem integrated into the lot!    The menu takes a minute to absorb just because they have a bunch of combos/platters all listed by numbers. It's nice they have some pictures so u get an easy of idea of what your getting. If u don't see a particular combo with the type of meat u want, just let them know and they will take care of it with no issue. Hence, that means the food is being prepared for you as fresh as possible.  While u wait a bit, help yourself to the chips and salsa bar. It gets messy with ease but that's because everyone is grabbing the chips and different salsas in those small containers. (Need to upgrade the station with some different containers and serving utensils that don't cause as much spillage. it can be a major turnoff if your walking in to see)  Food took a minute but we ordered fish tacos, mini tacos and a combo platter with carne asada taco and a burro along with rice & beans.   Unexpected goodness with the food for everyone. Looking forward to returning when in the area. Definitely a step up with different alternatives for combos the many of the chain locations in the valley. Realistically a 3.5 but I couldn't get over the mess people were leaving behind and no one was their to promptly clean it up. Actually no one came out for clean up.

The menu has all of the standards at reasonable prices.     I am a Los Dos Diablitos guy but this was quite tasty when in the Baseline Road area.

nIjh3cJmM1d7cghacFTAPQ.text: Finally found my Cali Mex in the A.Z # Outstanding!! It was pretty busy at lunch time too!  The greatest was the abundance of Hot Carrots offered - tastiest yet!   Beautiful salsa bar with three salsas. Sliced lime wedges, diced cucumber & sliced radishes.   Fresh homemade chips are filled often to the right of the station as well.  Carne Asada is flavorful and the perfect petite cuts that are sizzled / seasoned on that hot griddle to perfection.  Fresh guacamole is delish & the superb dip for those fresh tortilla chips!  The Chimichanga is gigantic. Well worth the price & you'll make two meals out of one!  Colorado burrito is enormous, was an added delight to have it "wet" with enchilada sauce on top!   Carne Asada Burrito is the True traditional authentic wrap- served with fresh guacamole & Pico De Gallo.   This is the SPOT! Please go see for yourself. You'll be glad you did!

Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chimichanga Burrito ( Wet)  Insanely Gigantic &amp; Great.  HUGE-Took half of it home for another meal.

b5Nf99mEf5AAlv-R0thg1A.text: I have driven by here for many years when coming to visit family nearby.  We've always kept on going because we eat at my family's house.  In this occasion, I was on my way to their house and had time to kill & hadn't eaten lunch.  When I walked in, I was a little discouraged to see it was needing a little sprucing up.  Anyways, I decided to try this place out.  I have been craving street tacos, but thought tacos of any kind would settle me.  What I liked a lot was the chips and salsa bar, where you help yourself.  I tried a red and a verde salsa.  Both were good with a little heat.  I got a pickled jalapeno and the last of the radishes.  They really needed to restock the chips & salsas, and condiments.  I decided to get a Fish Taco and an Adobada Taco.  The size of the tortillas was your regular sized corn tortillas, not the smaller street taco size.  At $2.49 a piece, I felt I got my money's worth.   I really enjoyed the fish taco.  The fish was hot and crispy.  It was topped with lettuce, pico de gallo & a white sauce.  The adobada taco was good, but was a little salty.  It was topped with guacamole & pico de gallo and enhanced the taco!  Don't judge the book by its' cover!  I would come back for a burrito or some other items that looked good, too!

4J5FEAvETWJq4hbK18dtew.text: The pictures speak for themselves!! Poliberto's serves the most authentic, delicious, and flavorful Mexican food I've had in the Tempe area. It had been a long crazy day before we stopped by and the smells inside the shop rejuvenated us haha. We ordered the chicken enchilada plate, three tacos plate (2 carne, 1 pastor), carne asada quesadilla, and three rolled tacos (shredded beef) with guac and cheese. The total was under $25 (minus tips) and the meals came with rice, beans, and drinks PLUS the serve-yourself Mexican salad bar. The chunky red salsa was by far our favorite (a pico?) and we were sad we didn't stock up on it cause literally anything tasted 10X better with it on lol. The chicken enchiladas were my favorite - they're literally stuffed. with chicken and topped with simple lettuce and cheese cause it doesn't need more than that and a handful of limes :3 I also really enjoyed the rolled tacos; my tip is to let the guac sit for a bit so it softens up the tortilla. Then you get a good crunchy start and the flavor of the guac gets to mix with the meat. There was a ridiculous amount of guac on top which I enjoyed and used with tortilla chips (they're also free and on the salad bar!). We will definitely be back!! Both to try more menu items and to get more of that pico! It was literally like teleporting to a shop in SanLuis MX - so nostalgic and comforting :)

gIKMxCRIDarPkIyXKAqz8Q.text: I really, truly love this place. There are many "-bertos" in Phoenix but this one is different. Their bean and cheese burritos are excellent, their salsa and chip bar is delicious, and the hard shell tacos and taquitos are sooo good.

xRBl6Evc6WaOxERnK_RMBA.text: Most amazing food I've ever had! Great price for huge portions. I got two meals out of my chimichanga. Will definitely be going back!

r2vsn1A9pdPu3uxElIHCig.text: The food was pretty good and the salsas were nice, but the menu is overwhelming and the whole place felt a bit dirty.  Maybe I just need to go more hole-in-the-wall places that are "come here for the food, don't be a snob about the floors".  If I find myself in Tempe again I'd go back to Poliberto's, but not sure when I'll be in Tempe again so...
