RigBZSeput2Y4D11CDWwaA.text: You MUST try the pollo adobado burrito !! The best thing I have eaten in a while !!!  Huge portions and great prices !!

itPPvW1LUNF1Z8M_6ctG5w.text: I've been here a couple of times. The food is good and fresh. Yes your order takes a few minutes but I think it's because it's fresh and made to order. They provide self serve chips and you can try the salsas that were also very tasty. Prices were good and contrary to what I've read in a couple of the reviews it was clean. It's a hole in the wall and the place is old but the food is very good along with reasonable prices. Definitely try the carnitas tacos, lots of meat and very authentic.

uUhguObJi-CPkYlSgigOLQ.text: I'm so happy I moved to this area and discovered Polibertos.  Coming from Chandler Blvd, my old "go to" was Espinozas r.I.p.....but yeah what every other 4-5 star viewer said.

7bhipqUfHK59njOwmXjFYg.text: The food was great! I enjoyed a chicken burrito and some awesome fries with basically everything on them. The horchata was phenomenal and filled my midnight cravings.

NTTeIe0DBy_1gQlVUMOTmg.text: I have lived next to this fine place for the last 2 years, but for over a year I had always thought of it as a seedy place full of roaches and tacos that would punish me for enjoying their delights. If I had a time machine I would go back in time and drop kick my face for even thinking that this was the case.   I had thought that all the ___berto's were the same, and having been to Filiberto's once, getting my order wrong, cold and dealing with the stench that was clouded around it gave my past self a bad image of all taco shops, but every day I would pass I would see Poliberto's full of people at all hours. I decided to take the plunge and try some of their tacos for myself, boy was that a good day!  I am a HUGE fan of getting the 3 mini taco plate combo, which is 3 double mini corn tortilla's pilled high with carne asada, lettuce, cheese, sour cream and guac with a side of beans and rice and a bottle of Coke. Fills you up for $6.50 - $7.00. The beef was tender, full of flavor and plentiful and they have several salsas to accompany your free freshly fried corn chips. I reccomend getting the chunky one, as it seems to be the best combo of flavor and spice.   The cleanliness of the place isn't sparkling, reflection in your face clean, but it isn't downright dirty either. The service for me is usually speedy and most days friendly, although sometimes the person at the front seems to not want to be there.  Overall the food is great, downright cheap, filling and they have Mexican Coke in the bottle!

a8Og8FLdwd6HOBgDtVmOFw.text: I ordered the California burrito, Carne Asada, potatoes, cheese and pico. I added avocado and got it enchilada style.  Once I got home and looked in the to go box I was very impressed. The portion was enormous and looked and smelled so good.  The first bite is where it all went wrong...it was like eating a salt burrito. I have never eaten anything so salty!   Too bad....

4zvk0UgW96k8FfhpJMKFPw.text: The family and I was on the lookout for some authentic Mexican food. We hit the jackpot! The portions are large at the right price. Some of the best food I've had in a long time!!

2M_17B6ooyLAyXpJoOKe9Q.text: I live right next to this place and I've always wanted to try it. I finally went in today and found it pleasantly packed. The restaurant smelled good--though a person could be turned off by the run-down condition of the restaurant.   I ordered the shredded beef burrito and it was quite good. The tortilla was firm, and delicious. The guac is clearly homemade. The beef was of good quality but not that 'shredded' it was more like chunks of easily pulled apart beef.  I enjoyed what I ate but I'm still left with the feeling that the food was missing something, I don't know what!

ygmOZ-8hjtCepVEoDWF16Q.text: my boyfriend and i always come here! its the best mexican fast food restaurant out there! food is always up to our standards with fresh ingredients!

3rkh8NtbebWOUBW7ldCIVg.text: Great "hole in the wall" type Mexican place. Tons of menu choices and everything I have had is tasty, fresh and in portions too big to finish. My favs: the Carne asada, burrito, green Chile and my favorite breakfast - the green chilaquiles. Prices cannot be beat and impressively, the food is made to order.  Love this place!

kfoD43ikQS4SMJ4ltWer5g.text: Having this place in walking distance from your apartment is a dream come True.  Amazing, satisfying Mexican "fast" food (you may have to wait a bit but it's worth it).  THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE BERTO'S.  Super affordable delicious food with sizable proportions and a delightful salsa bar.    My husband and I usually get the two burrito combo, one with carne asada and one with adobada.  OMG SO GOOD.  If you split a large drink, too, it comes out to about $8 for two people.  Miraculous when you are hung over.  And they are open at pretty much all hours so you can totally saunter over here at 9am and chill with an interesting assortment of early-risers.  This place does not have a drive-through so keep that in mind.  I have taken out-of-towners here on two separate occasions and it did not disappoint.  One more thing -- I always get a horchata and it is never bottom-of-the-barrel gritty like it can be at some places.

oyVaHdSnN7ZNIgPiVBZ1fg.text: Whenever we drive by here, the place is always packed.  Taking that to be a good sign, we decided to stop in for lunch.  Even though there were a number of people there, they took our order quickly and overall service was excellent.  The combo of the three mini tacos was delicious.  The refried beans were the best beans I've ever had, and everything was steaming hot and fresh.  Prices were very reasonable and atmosphere was good too.  Definitely going back again.

JfRe6PfMWWuQEJ0KSZ6ZQA.text: There isn't really anything for me to say about this place. It's not bad, but it isn't great either. The primary reason that my girlfriend and I keep going back is that it is literally right next to her apartment complex, so it is as convenient as it gets for us.   It's the same greasy, fast, mexican food that you get at all those other generic places around the valley. You know, the ones with the giant, colorful menus on the wall that all look the exact same? I won't mention any specific food that we had, because there wasn't anything really special, good or bad, worth mentioning.  The people that work there are just that, there. I've only ever seen the same girl, but she looks like she doesn't enjoy it there, as I have never seen her smile.  In conclusion, the only two things that really make it worth going here are that it is very inexpensive, and, for us, the location is unbeatable when we don't want to cook and don't want to go anywhere. I won't tell you not to go there, but don't expect anything special when you do.

BTOtrzJMmvLYajVmkgQqLQ.text: Best place for cheap greasy tasty Mexican food. Every thing on the menu looks great but I usually only have the carne asada fries or Guacamole supremea.  Oh carne asada fries! They start out with a huge plate of fries then pile carne asada meat on top. Then next add on the sourcream, cheese, and guacamole. Oh so good. A little on the greasy side but still quite tasty.  Now even better the quesadilla supremea, so delicious!! Large flour tortilla filled with all the good stuff. Carne asada meat and cheese layered with sour cream and guacamole.  Everything on the menu is reasonable priced and they even have some specialty Mexican foods. But all at semi-fast food style.  I can't wait to get back to Phoenix for some more.

1gdyCmgjszGgXosN-Q8qFg.text: Huge tacos at a great price, although I wish I would have know the tacos came with pico on them. Free chips were great! Cheese Enchilada had way too much sauce on it. I'll definitely be back, but next time no pico & not a lot of sauce.

HmuLQZewlzhKDrO1etjweQ.text: How can you not love this place? It's cheap. It's easy. They have menudo for crying out loud. Many are open 24/7, which is awesome if you work a weird shift or are drunk and coming home from the bar. I'll take this over taco bell any day of the week and twice on Sundays. Please expand to other states.

K6apLZ8Hy2eojOpSnrGtMg.text: Great service. Huge menu. Food cooked fresh to order-not typical fast food restaurant. Three different types of salsa, limes, chips, and hot carrots.

OcnXeIMPRLeX_JUAhHnYjg.text: Come and get it! You can pass all the other Berto's, this one tops them all....including in portions and price.

zd6SjuR8z1TzqthbfPIUyg.text: I live right across the street from this restaurant. It looks a little shabby from the outside, and the same goes for the inside as well. However, a True Mexican food fan like myself knows that it is usually the worst looking places that have the best food.  I ordered the Carne Asada Burrito plate, and it was wonderful. It tasted just like the food I was used to in Southern California, so I was glad to have a little taste of home. I will be coming back!!!

RBL9UM37dgiVyWBY1c8vPA.text: I dunno... I don't really get the rave reviews.  I got a chicken taco which was completely soggy by the time I got home (only about 5 minutes after I ordered it because I live down the road) and a cheese enchilada combo with rice and beans.  The beans do taste fresh.  The rice is decent.  The enchilada is ok but lukewarm and the cheese isn't even melted... it's still all shredded up inside.  The salsa at the bar is good though.

XEbTA7KC-ERFp9uDrraMoQ.text: Excellent food, big portions and good prices. Original mexican taste, a wide variety on the menu and free carrots, cucumbers, chips and salsas! Became a regular already.

049N72ftCJ-YaZeox680zQ.text: Have visited this place twice during two visits to the Tempe area.... Food is amazing, you will NOT be disappointed....  The BEST mexican food I've tasted in a very long time...

0N5hY9UVWKTRSM7gxALfEg.text: Great place for inexpensive and good Mexican food.  Not much on atmosphere, but the food is good and the price is right.  Love the carnitas here!!

E4noaMatg7UG2t5j_4Pe6A.text: I live nearby and there are at least 6+ "...berto"-style Mexican fast food joints within a mile.  While I miss the former Chinese Buffet's fried chicken, this is THE GEM in Tempe for fast food! Huge menu, helpful staff. Poliberto's Tacos de Lengua are the best anywhere! Beef Enchiladas are so full of tender meat, onion, & chile (bell pepper). The "Salsa Bar" with sauces, cucumber, radish, limes, and Jalapenos/carrots en escabeche are such welcome condiments/sides. Everything I've ordered here over the years has been excellent, & the prices give the very best value. I just wish that they had (1) rajas of roasted poblano chile, not just mild bell pepper, (2) AZ-style green chile (for burros), & (3) Piquancy or "Chilosity" - nothing  - not even the salsa de molcajete - is picante, just mild. iPor favor! So, you may need to stand in line for a while to order, but do it... It's really worth the wait! .I may even head over there tonight ... again!

MQP-FVUhlUS5apViP8-Zow.text: Coming from Tucson, I looked for a Mexican place that would equal Nico's taco shop. I love being able to grab a burrito and go about my life. I have tried their California burrito and a carne asada burrito and they were both good. The food is fresh but it does take time to get. I don't mind waiting though. I really like their salsas and appreciate the free chips. This has become my go to for a burrito on a day where I just don't care to cook.

eg8ls3FdG9Uld19yo9Pm9g.text: When I lived in CA, you couldn't throw a rock without finding a 24 Hour Mexican drive thru place that was literally the most delicious food you could ever imagine stuffing into your maw. Moving to AZ, I had a REALLY hard time finding one that was even passable within a five mile radius of my house.  Luckily, I went to Polibertos one day because it was there and I was hungry after a trip at Fry's, and it's mostly filled  that hole in my heart. I do wish there was a drive thru, but c'est la vie.  The food is pretty good, I always like the roll tacos and they give you a good amount of guacamole. I particularly like the Fajita burrito and the Ranchera burrito. It is really slow getting your food, in part because there are a decent amount of patrons (probably because the food is good), and in part because there are only like two people working here at any given time.   The hot sauce/other accouterments bar has a good variety, and I appreciate the little sandwich baggies for your jalapenos/limes/etc. I do wish people wouldn't constantly hover over this, and I will never forget seeing some ASU frat boy clean out 1/2 the bar even though he ordered one measly burrito, but that's nothing I can fault the restaurant for.  Four stars because it's good and satisfies my need when I want Mexican fast food.

I804JqhTUtL2ZGwpwpoW8Q.text: If you're in the Tempe area and need a good hearty breakfast at a great price, stop by here and get the Spanish Omlette w/machaca and you won't need to eat again the rest of the day!! For $6.58 (out the door w/tax) you get a giant omlette which looks like it must be 3-4 eggs, filled with at least 1/2lb of shredded beef & grilled veggies (peppers, onions, tomatoes), a giant scoop of grilled diced potatoes, and a huge side of rice & beans! Everything was cooked and seasoned perfectly, piping hot fresh off the grill. When topped with some of the their fresh homemade pico it is out of this world! I wanted to eat the entire thing so bad, but rather than do so and regret it for the rest of the morning I saved the other half for lunch.  Can't beat getting a delicious breakfast and lunch for under $7! They also have amazing breakfast burritos for $3-$4 which are just as hearty and filling, but today the Spanish Omlette grabbed my eye and did a very good job at filling my belly for the day. I think next time I'll add jalapenos though because it could have used a little extra kick, other than that it was perfect.   I still don't understand how this place isn't ranked as one of the top Mexican places in Phoenix. It may have to do with the "berto's" at the end of their name so everyone immediately associates them with the Filiberto's/Julioberto's/Eriberto's/etc. fast food/take-out places, but this is a totally different type of place and not related to those others in any way (in fact, none of them are even related to each other!). It is not "Mexcian Fast Food" at all, in fact it's not fast at all - I've waited as long as 20 minutes for an order before. Not because they're slow, but because everything is made 100% from scratch when you order it and they get pretty busy around the main meal times. I try to go either late morning to beat the lunch rush, or mid-afternoon for a late lunch, those are the times when it is the last crowded.   Do yourself a favor and check this place out! Or better yet, don't, and let it remain one of the best kept Mexican food secrets in the state. :)

Fc28D6jnOtpgRuZQvjPx5w.text: Absolutely everything you could ask for of a taco shop north of the border! Complimentary chips and salsa bar with excellent salsas! My sister and I ordered the #24 with two carne asada burritos. Very generous portions and excellently marinaded crane asada! Gracias Polibertos por su excelente calidad y servicio!

WHRYgGU1TE2GJ5VqvX4LsQ.text: No pretension. This taqueria has excellent carnitas, low prices, free chips, and a variety of salsa. For about $14 the two of us got more food than we could eat, two mini taco plates. They let us choose different kinds of meats for the three tacos and we found chicken, carnitas, and steak to all be tasty! The food took a little while, as other reviewers warned, but we got to munch on chips while we waited and were very happy with the experience overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mini Taco Plate. Yum!!

jwAcYwsw3niQvXIuZUiNPA.text: We stopped in on a weeknight evening around 9pm to pick up food to go.  Upon walking in you may consider turning around, but if you can get past the disheveled and untidy atmosphere you should try a taco!  Customers are invited to fill up a bag of complimentary chips and salsa, unfortunately when we arrived they were out.  They offer a wide variety of menu items and prompt service.  We ordered the shredded beef hard shell tacos and chicken flautas.  The meats were lacking seasoning and didn't add the most flavor to the dishes.  Overall, the food didn't quite satisfy my craving.

oxPWQEsNqGbNe9ejs4Adnw.text: Oooo me gusta Poliberto's!  At first, I wasn't sure why the tacos were $2.45 but once I saw how big they were I can say - the price is well justified...like Justin Timberlake.  I ordered four soft tacos: cabeza, lengua, pescado, and carnitas.  The lengua was pretty tasty & juicy, the cabeza was soft and tender, the pescado was almost on par with what I'm used to at Senor Fish back in Los Angeles, but what really got me was the carnitas.  The only way I can accurately describe eating them is, "Carnitas be crispy like I ain't eva seen!  I ate one of them and I was like WHAAAAAT ARE YOU SERIOUS, POLIBERTO???"  Best of all, I saved half of each taco for the next day, reheated them and they were STILL GOOD.  Winner, winner, carnitas dinner!

Iw-uwEmlPcctC2l0w1X4Hw.text: This place is too cool. Food is great and there are so many selections for you to chose from. I mean you get 4 chicken flautas for 2.99 what is there to complain about? There is a chips and salsa bar right in front so you don't have to ask. The best I had here was the chicken rellenos it is so delicious.

MtQnKZvFVRUrHiGFZrRh3Q.text: Very good breakfast burrito. The salsa bar was fresh and tasty too. As Arnold would say....I will be back....

HYTQwRFrEDILPHvuHDBNeA.text: The food here is superb.  We had several selections and everything was excellent.  The service was quick and the portions were very generous.  The only reason they're getting 4 stars instead of 5 is that the dining area was not clean.

7s1ISaCvFff17jhXjx4M-A.text: Disgusting.  Went at 10pm and every table and floor leading to registers dirty.  Ordered food to go to eat at the hotel and after taking a bite of a few different items we knew this was the worst Mexican food we have ever had.  Threw the food out and had to order a pizza.  Wasted $20..

MFjAHDTLjQZccFMeVw34Xw.text: Great, quality Mexican food at very reasonable prices. Will be returning to next time I'm in Phoenix.

tFDo6YPIHAOwhdknA_mNng.text: I don't understand why people would give this place 5 stars, as a matter of fact, I don't understand why people give mediocre places 5 stars.  5 stars is for the best thing you've ever eaten.  This place is no better than any of the other barf-o-berto's.  The parking lot smelled good and gave me hope, but as soon as we walked in, the smell instantly became something comparable to body order.  This place is pretty gross on the inside, about as gross as all the other berto's.  I ordered a #13 chimichanga with carne asada which is $1 extra.  They set the chimi on a bed of lettuce which, anyone with any sense would know, caused the lettuce to start weeping it's water out into the container.  So my chimi was going for a lettuce water swim.  We also got the two beef tacos, which were advertised as $5 on Monday special, but were charged full price anyway.  The cashier was not friendly, not unfriendly either, just kinda there.  We won't be coming back here.

MzpAKbQWmIQHmepa1ujX5Q.text: After eating some of the worst Mexican food ever at F-berto's nearby, I decided to try Poliberto's after work....While it was overall better than my traumatic experience, I can't say this was that much better.   I made a huge mistake ordering the Carne Asada Torta...everything fell apart and the meat tasted really bad.  I'm used to a good, fulfilling, crunchy big torta like they make them in SF for the same exact price.  Unfortunately, this torta failed miserably in comparison.  I seriously have no clue where to get good Mexican food in Phoenix/Tempe/Scottsdale, but I won't give up without a fight.

KTsmKnqKDJxrh3lCV3khmA.text: Being a native Californian (Los Angeles area) I'm always on the hunt for decent hole in the wall Mexican. I now live in TN where the mexicam is sad. Polibertos - I feel like I have come home!  I primarily judge a place on its carne asada burritos. I ordered one specifically basic to taste the quality of each component. Meat,  beans, rice, cheese. I must say I was impressed when I saw my roll waiting for my pickup at the counter. The tortilla was fresh and perfectly cooked. The carne asada was seasoned and chopped to perfection. The beans were real refried beans and the cheese was straight forward cheddar (which I expect). Even though this roll was sizable I actually contemplated getting another one because my taste buds were in heaven.   Everything about this place met and exceeded my expectations for a hole in the wall,  walk up counter joint. The salsa bar had great selection and all 4 salsas I tried were delish!   Take a pass on other trendy or restaurant places of you are craving some real tasty food!  I'll be back the next time I'm in town!

zZwBCZMHT57PFnaYFTS2iA.text: Second time to visit and the veggie burrito was pretty tasty!  I like the salsa bar each of the salsas has a very unique flavor.  TVs up kind of loud and doesn't get very good reception so it breaks up quite a bit,  which can be irritating.  Overall for a Taqueria pretty good all-around: nice environment, nice staff, excellent food.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oh so happy!  Look at the size of that Burro!

7fr0N-AK2LLdPkXabWGjrw.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast burritos! I've had both the chorizo and the potato, egg, and cheese. They are pretty large, so one is more than enough for me.   I will say that the inside of this shop looks a bit on the cheaper side. I would take your food to-go because there isn't really a great ambiance here for sitting to enjoy your food. They are pretty quick too with the burritos so there was not a long wait!

J6npR1XJRzFDhlmgOo86DQ.text: I decided to give this place a try since the reviews are so high...plus I was craving a breakfast burrito. I'm about to give a lot of information that you may think will contradict my rating but please, just bear with me.   After finding the eatery, I parked and got our of my car. Oh boy, I was getting nervous. The place looked run down and dirty. There was debris in the parking lot; containers, pieces of trash and such. Behind the restaurant was another unidentified building. Maybe it's the owners home..? The outside of the eatery didn't look appealing at all but I thought, "Nope, Yelp says it's great. I can usually rely on my fellow Yelpers." Take a deep breath! As I walked inside, I purposely didn't look around. Instead I immediately looked at the menu chose my dish, ordered, and paid. I ordered a chorizo breakfast burrito with potato and cheese.  I ended up waiting about 10 minutes since there were a few orders ahead of mine. This, unfortunately, gave me time to look around. Old food stuck onto floors that looked like they hadn't been mopped in ages. There was some other dark smudges that I couldn't make out what it was...or had been. Large areas of paint peeling off the walls, bits of paper from straw sleeves laying around, clumps of dust and cob webs hanging around the air vents and upper corners of the building. There was a wooden bench that looks like a couple slates were missing from its seat. The place really needed to be thoroughly scrubbed.  While waiting I helped myself to two different kinds of salsa from the salsa bar. Finally my food was ready. I was surprised at how heavy the bag felt. I drove back to work and opened the yellow paper that contained my burrito. My god the thing was huge! It was like a small baby! Alright, so, the test! I took my fork and knife cut off a bite, put a little of the fresh red salsa on it and ate it. Wow, It was EXACTLY what I have been looking for in a breakfast burrito!!! The chorizo was spicy, the potatoes seasoned, the egg not dried out, the cheese gooey and melty, and the tortilla was the perfect texture. It had that, almost, transparent look to it, you know, the kind where you know it was handmade. Then I tried it with the green salsa verde! Omg!! So flavorful and delicious! I was in breakfast burrito heaven! However, the thing was so big that I could only eat half.  So! Now you understand my high rating despite my earlier comments.  This is a True "hole in the wall". Do I want to know what their kitchen looks like, HELL NO! But I will continue to go back because the food is THAT good. I'm so glad my Yelpers didn't let me down. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito with chorizo, egg, potato, and cheese. Delicious!!

p8avHeCSt-nCgpYPZszOnA.text: I've been here a couple of times mainly getting breakfast burritos or a carne asana burrito but I must say that their food is excellent! It takes a bit for the food to come out but that is because it is all made to order. They provide a chips and salsa bar while you wait which is convenient. Their prices are very cheap and you get some quality food!  Don't be overwhelmed by the location though. It's technically located in Tempe, but just blocks away from the town of Guadalupe.  I definitely see myself coming here a lot more often!

ed8WPYDfv4ujD6x7uaYiBA.text: Have to follow suit. On the out side and when you walk in there are two things you will either imeediately notice or will soon notice. One it looks and smells like any typical dingy taco stand in Phoenix. But do not let that dissuade you. There is obviously a reason why dispite the ambiance and spotlessness; or lack there of this place has 4 stars. That brings me to the second reason...  The line that are either there or soon will. This is because the food is pretty darn good. I will say for me it is better than any whole-in-the-wall taco stand Ive been too in the valley.  Realy good food, generous portions, salsa bar, good prices, and lots and lots of bustling happy customers. Eh smells funny and the tables are not kept up as much as we may want but yup a fair four star earn.

w1GvCUU2qzWjcro5494_nw.text: I've ate at alot of Mexican restaurants and alot of different "bertos" establishments but this place and the food here is so authentic and delicious,  you might need your passport.  Good thing it's only on Baseline in Tempe! Right down the street from Arizona Mills.  The food is amazing and the lines are long but it is worth the wait! Just giving props where it's due.

eKU7xgEQVnEoDcCzcuMpmw.text: This place was everything I was looking for in a Mexican place (aka authentic). Great value, excellent salsa, free chips, large selection. The carne asada fries brought me back to my college days and the churros were on point too. 10/10 would recommend and would visit again.

thpMA4wXU5Hy2BuXzhKFuQ.text: Hands down a favorite of mine!  We had just landed in Arizona, looking for a place to enjoy warm, quality food. Surprisingly to us, the price was affordable!  A must for those in this area!!

jPbqdKHP4DEGKICzyFO7CA.text: This little place is AMAZING! The food is cooked fresh as you order, I had the chicken adobada burrito, with guacamole and pico de gallo. Got to say the burrito not only tasted amazing, but the chicken was so tender and juicy that it left me begging for more.   Their salsa bar has 4 different types of salsa, pickled carrots and jalapenos, lemon and some othher stuff. I tried the green and chuncky red salsa, they were really good.   My only complaint is that I didn't find this place sooner...

zAemxSTsTx835AxxMXaE8A.text: Not fancy, not even pretty, but great food at a great price! I had the Chili Verde with rice and beans. The flour tortilla was warm and soft. The CV was tender and just the right amount of spicy. The refried beans needed a little help but their complimentary roasted pepper salsa was the perfect spike. OK the rice was just kind of plain rice but 3 out of 4 ain't bad and all this plus a drink (soda) for under $10 is a great deal. Sorry no pictures this time. The food smelled so good I started eating before I remembered to take a shot. And a picture of the interior just wouldn't  live up to the food.

jAK4JX7hZNeYJ_rATiKZ1w.text: Hands down the best breakfast burrito joint in the area. My boyfriend and I were slightly obsessed for a while, and still would be if we had not moved. He always ordered a ham breakfast burrito with potatoes, egg, sour cream and cheese. I'm a weirdo and would always order a breakfast burrito with bell peppers, potatoes, sour cream and cheese. Or maybe it's not a breakfast burrito since there's no egg? Oops.  Anyways, I think one of the most distinguishable things about this place is the salsa bar. I love my salsa. Mild, medium or spicy... Red or green... I will bathe my burrito in it and devour. They have some great salsas here, folks. They also offer chips so you can have some chips and salsa while you're waiting for your food. My boyfriend also likes munching on the cucumber and radish slices.   The parking is not the best around this joint, but I highly recommend the place overall.  Also, they do TO-GO orders! Always great since this place is always busy on weekend mornings!

Du9M9C5BpIutb-Dj7q7J2Q.text: I've been here more times than I care to admit but it's always good for a quick fresh meal. Pretty basic Mexican but the floutas are a great deal. The adobada pork is super flavorful and so are their beans. Much more white Mexican than I usually eat, but it's cheap and close and fresh, so I'll take it!

UAbyfl-jHGf1GVprhg1Nbg.text: Got there at 8:00 am, doors were locked and I waited outside for at least 12 minutes before leaving. Couldn't see anyone inside but could smell food being cooked.  There were several people waiting. At least open the doors/let people know you're not ready yet and apologize.

HlowoX8B8wACjQDil9u-xw.text: I got the #10 carnitas plate and for 8 bucks holy smokes there was a ton of grubbing going down, the carnitas were off the hook! Crispy and tender and not too salty,  place is busy and tables were dirty if that's a problem for yah but that doesn't equate in my reviews only awesome food, totally going back for some cabeza tacos

4uG7HAdw-lVzXiCfRq3z2A.text: Went in and got a chicken chimichanga and the 2 beef taco combination. When I opened the boxes everything looked really good. Unfortunately the food didn't really taste like anything. The best part of the meal was the rice that came with the combination plate.

jpDXpcKXpAgPcMcHuL4S_Q.text: Featured on local TV news recently for receiving multiple violations from the the local health department. Willing to chance it? Really? Then you're my kind of guy. Forget those silly food safely laws. They cook everything to death anyway. Just avoid the carne asada fries. Sounds like heaven. It isn't.

5I1XFpzUfqpN9EcVypO7hQ.text: Omg visiting in phx saw,this place on yekp, don't expect fancy it's a taco shop in the hood. Which is prob why it was cheap but oh so goood. All I wanted this trip was a taco. ..so missed them they even had Cabeza and length street taco...hmmm

r_Fd2QoTB9-hCg1nzwE8Iw.text: Poli b's!!!!! My friends and I love this place! It's definitely a bit of a dive and there are nicer filibertos but this place is great. The staff is super kind and friendly! Come enough and they remember you! I used to get the chicken burrito which was great but now I typically get the rice and bean burrito and it's delicious. The salsas are yummy and the flavor a are authentic!

y3kjHrfNdUTN-DG2NfREJA.text: This place was amazing and the best Mexican I had in AZ.  It is very similar to a San Diego taco shop & the prices are excellent.  They have a salsa bar with hot carrots, a big plus for me.    I had rolled tacos with guacamole & cheese and a shredded beef hard shell taco.  They were all great.  The locals appeared to really like this place and told me they come at least once a week.    The inside was a little dirty (tables not clean) but when asked they did come clean them.  You could tell they had been and continued to be busy & the cashier did everything, but cook.   I am so glad I found this place on my trip, you must give it a try.

2IYZ2ch7WTGkEfPFicSLQQ.text: Never miss no.21, it's awesome. I did tried other menu too! Always open until midnight.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. No.7 pork steak without beans! Awesome!

Y1W9XzyE4HZsNyXhv3TjRw.text: Good cheese enchiladas and red chile burrito! Small place but definitely worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Poliberto's Taco Shop - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheese Enchiladas, so good!
